Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RubyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location, and although it is close to a not-so-great area, the proximity to places like Chinatown and Gastown outweighed any negatives for me and I didn't have any bad experiences. The bathroom was nice and spacious, with an attractive tiled floor, and the bed was two singles pushed together to make for an extremely wide (although kind of short) bed with plenty of room to spread out in. If you like a ton of space in the hotel room itself, then this hotel might not be great for you, but I found it wasn't a big deal. The rooms were a little warm and the a/c unit didn't help much. The continental breakfast was the standard bagels/muffins, cereal, and some fruit. There were two hot items available, which were egg and pancakes/waffles, but neither of those appealed to me. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a good location and an affordable, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable & conveniently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennaMarie360
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The room was updated but small, I was travelling alone so this was perfect. The bed was very comfortable. With the windows closed there was almost no road noise. Everything was clean and well kept. This room also included breakfast. In comparison so other hotels at the same price point this was a selling feature for me. Breakfast was your typical continental style however it also included two hot items. It was overall good value for my money. The location was also great. It is a ten minuet walk to Rogers Arena and is in a pretty safe area. You can also easily walk to the heart of things in down town Vancouver. It's also easy to access transit. The service was prompt and friendly and I was even able to check in early without an extra fee! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from this hotel which set the benchmark for our round-the-world trip!”
Reviews.Author: Dextina
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop to our honeymoon, and after a 14 hour flight from Sydney, my husband and I were very pleased with the service at this hotel and managed a slightly earlier check in as well. All staff in the hotel from housekeeping, management and front reception gave exceptional service! We travelled around the world on our honeymoon and stayed at many hotels. Ramada Limited Downtown was the benchmark and best hotel we stayed at (and we stayed at some pretty fancy ones along the way). The room was spacious and very clean with a super comfortable bed. We had a problem with our toilet but maintenance staff fixed this straight away. The free wi-fi is handy, and the breakfast was delicous! The hotel is just around the corner from Chinatown and Gastown, and walking distance to shopping areas. You can take a bus to Stanley Park, but we walked and it only took about 25 minutes. The people of Vancouver are some of the most friendliest in the world, and this included the staff at the Ramada Limted Downtown. Next time we are in Vancouver we'll be sure to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AzureAkela
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Pacific Centre, Gastown, China Town and transit links to elsewhere. We walked from here along the sea front to Stanley Park and then picked up the trolley bus tour which brought us to within a couple of blocks of the hotel. The room was clean, bed comfortable and despite being next to the ice machine was not too noisy - and i am a light sleeper. The room temperature was managed well by the air con system. As well as a luggage stand there was a large poof on which a case could be opened, great for a short stay when you don't want to unpack fully. All else found as listed by previous reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Jess P
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic. Anywhere we needed/wanted to go the staff would help us with when, where and how to get there. They also helped by arranging taxis to the airport at ridiculous hours of the morning. The rooms were small but comfy. The bed in our room was two singles pushed together but we hardly noticed. The breakfast was very satisfying although the breakfast dining area is a little dim. I enjoyed my stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: for0410
Reviews.Content: Smaller room, i booked for Queen size bed but they give me a 2beds combine to be queen bed. A little Noisy and you can hear teenagers running down the hall. Receptionist are very friendly and breakfast staff very attentive.Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: weniale
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel over the other Ramada on Granville I had previously stayed at due to location. While the neighborhood leaves a bit to be desired, the location more than makes up for that. Short walking distance to Rogers Arena, Granville Street and Waterfront Station, it was perfect for my needs. There was a odd situation with the beds. I had booked 1 Queen but upon checking in, I was given a room with a King. Well, what I thought was a King bed until further investigation. It was actually two Twins pushed together. It wasn't a major concern as I was traveling alone but weird that there was no foamie or padding of any kind to disguise that it was two beds pushed together. Just something to watch out for. The room itself was small, but clean minus a clump of hair in the heating unit and some cobwebs in the corner. I only went down for breakfast once and would advice going earlier than I did (at 9am) because they seemed to be running out of the offered items. There was juice, toast, bagels, cereal and fruit. Nothing amazing but good for a quick breakfast. Overall, I would definitely return (and plan to this summer) this hotel. Everyone I dealt with was friendly and very helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service culture”
Reviews.Author: russson
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very helpful. Not having stayed in Vancouver very often I asked about local jazz venues. One of the staff called her husband who is a musician and later call me in my room with information about local venues. this is one example that shows a staff culture of genuine interest and wanting you to have a pleasant stay. when they say "have a good day" I really believe they ment it. Room was clean & bed comfy. Value for your $.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: veteran98
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel located within walking distance of everything within downtown Vancouver. Gastown and Chinatown are only steps away and the convention centre and Robson street only a 10-15 minute walk.. It's an older hotel that offers great value at less than half at what you would pay elsewhere. It also offers free wireless internet and a nice continental breakfest which is also free.. This is the fifth time we have stayed here and have never been disappointed. It is a great place to stay for those on a budget and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful at all times.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Lois P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value. The rooms are small but very clean. They are nicely decorated and the bed and linens are very comfy. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful - Mina, Katiuska and Leo set the cheerful tone. The breakfast is abundant. The location is very central- close to Canada Place, the Seabus and Gastown. The Ramada Limited is an excellent value for a low priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Good location, Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Ali G
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the location in Gastown. Lots to do in the area for families. It also had a breakfast included which was a nice addition. It was an OK place to stay but we wouldn't hurry to return. The staff were really friendly and that impressed us. The only drawback was the size of the room. It was tiny. For a family of 4 it was really too small.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Signora123
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good area located few minutes walk from bus stops, local shopping district, short bus ride away from places like Granville Island, stanley park etc. Rooms were nice, spacious, comfy beds and cosy, quiet - would definitely recommend this hotel, well kept and clean. Breakfast was plentyful - became a little boring after a few days though! need more of a range of hot foods only offered powdered eggs and a meat choice, but can't complain, plent of choices and hot drinks, we had cereal, choice of fruits toast and bagels! Absoultely adored British columbia, beautiful province with fantastic friendly people. Vancouver and Vancouver Island made the long trip over from UK well worth it within a matter of seconds. Fell in love with Canada and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected haven in the heart of Gastown”
Reviews.Author: Phreddiva
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this gem in the middle of gastown some years ago, on our first trip together to Vancouver. I wanted something close to gastown, he wanted something close to his family. We decided on this area, but hotels were limited to the extremely seedy to the extremely expensive. We took a chance on the Ramada and were pleasantly surprised. Clean rooms, big beds, some flat screens and recently (since our last visit) improved toiletries. Housekeeping is obnoxiously, without apology, loud in the hallway. Really inexcusable, but hey. A somewhat small price to pay, and they don't start until after 9. Maybe it's their way of saying we're lazy? Their housekeeping was, after all, perfectly lovely. Additionally, service generally here is fantastic, way above par for what we paid. Wifi is free (huzzah!), breakfast is included, and valet parking (well worth it so we can park and walk to all food/shopping) is $28/day. Thanks again, Ramada!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwarleyBravo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a two minute walk of the waterfront station and easy walking distance to downtown shopping centers and Granville Street entertainment area. To those other reviewers, yes the rooms are small, but they have plenty of storage space and everything you need. When booking this hotel you have to understand and appreciate it is a boutique hotel, I really loved the touch the hotel presented. All staff were very helpful and great to deal with. Breakfast was great. There are laundry facilities at the hotel too, which is a great asset. Also for those wanting to catch a hockey game, Rogers Arena is about a ten minute walk. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Selahrs
Reviews.Content: This was another instance in which a grand old hotel has been re-modeled and re-branded to become a very affordable, convenient place to stay. Our room was good, although a little oddly shaped. The TV was in a chiffarobe in an alcove of the room. The room was generally very clean - except for the rug. The rug was a trifle grimy, and in this case, buckled so that we had to be careful not to trip over it. Our window faced the main street and let huge amounts of sun pour in. It was easy to be blinded and overheated here unless you were very diligent and inventive about closing the curtains. The view was great though. We could look out and watch the picturesque proceedings at an eccentric hair salon in an old building across the street. The included continental breakfast was offered in a small basement room that was usually crowded to overflowing. A small, harmless fire involving the toaster there necessitated our having to evacuate the building one Sunday morning. I usually preferred to eat at the "Smile" Cafe across the street. Also, the staff was very friendly - however they failed to issue us our wake-up call one morning. No harm done. Our alarm clock came through. These small negatives aside - the overall value of the place was great. The Hotel is on a bus route that will take you directly to Stanly Park. The harbor and other parts of downtown are all within walking distance. There's free access to a computer in an alcove in the lobby, so if you don't have a Wi-Fi- ready computer with you, you can still check the Internet at almost any time. It's otherwise almost impossible to find such a good place in the $100-a-night range in the heart of downtown Vancouver. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great value, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Boriski
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of Ramada hotels in Vancouver. This one is in West Pender Street. In some 3 months of travelling across the US and Canada, this has been our favourite hotel so far. We liked it so much we stayed almost three weeks – broken by a driving trip to Banff and return. Overall: Really comfortable stay in a nicely decorated room complete with refrigerator and microwave. Great value and reasonably quiet. Best room tip: Rooms ending in x07 above the third floor are in the very corner of the hotel, and you’ll get two windows (that can open). We stayed in 607 and had no noisy footsteps above us, with a view of the snow dusted nearby mountains and the harbour. This was the first hotel in several months we didn't need earplugs to sleep. Minor annoyances: We returned from Banff around 11:30pm and had to park the vehicle ourselves, but were still charged the full overnight rate for valet parking ($25 per night). Valet parking finishes at 11pm. Free internet was reasonable but patchy (can’t make skype calls), but will do the job if you need it for the occasional email check. We also stayed in room #403 for a couple of days, which was a much smaller room for the same price (one chair, no refridgerator, no microwave, and the only window opens onto an alley and building). Ramada had a ‘stay 3 nights and get 20% off’ deal, so we got two queen sized beds and breakfast for around $78 per night booked direct on their website. Breakfast was a great selection and included a hot dish of egg (patty) and small breakfast sausage, pancakes sometimes, hot waffles and the usual assortment of cereal, bagels, toast, juice, tea/coffee and muffins. Is served in the basement and there’s usually enough seating for everyone. Breakfast runs until 9:30am and later on weekends. Our 607 room also had two chairs and a desk. Bedding and pillows were comfy. An adjustable heater/air-con in the room worked well (and quietly). Large selection of cable channels on the flat screen. Washing machines and driers are available in the basement for a small fee. A free daily local newspaper was provided each day. Drink/snack machine & ice machine also available on a couple of floors. This hotel is in walking distance to lots of things. It’s a two block uphill walk (small incline) from the light rail station (Skytrain) – catchable from Vancouver Airport into the waterfront terminal for around $7.50 per person. Close by is the fashion shopping precint in Robson Street (around 4 blocks); Gastown restaurants & souvenirs (look for the steam powered clock); the Vancouver lookout tower (go back up in the evening on your earlier ticket, for gorgeous sunset views); Vancouver Public Library (free, strong internet for 2 hours); Vancouver Art Gallery; the Vancouver Convention Centre (six blocks), a couple of 24/7 convenience stores (good for a cheap heat-up-in-the-microwave-in-your-room meal); a large post office; a couple of sports bars serving good meals; Rogers Arena (8 blocks – catch a game of ice hockey) and BC Place Stadium (catch a game of gridiron – 7 blocks). There are also several coffee shops (Starbucks, Waves, Tim Hortons) within two blocks. Thrifty and Budget car rentals also nearby. The hotel is next door to a (homeless?) lodge and you’ll get plenty of requests for money and/or cigarettes if you’re waiting outside the front of the hotel, but people mostly seem harmless. We also found Gastown particularly bad for requests for money. Also next door is a sports bar that offers 10% discount for hotel guests. Innovative menu but can be a bit noisy and 'blokey', and rooms facing onto West Pender street are likely to get a bit of street noise on the weekend from sports bar patrons. Staff here were amongst the most genuine and helpful we’ve encountered in three months of travel across Canada. Whilst this doesn’t impact on the comfort of your stay, their friendliness made for a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: theryguy23
Reviews.Content: I was here for business with a few colleagues. The location was awesome, we walked to our conference in downtown Vancouver. The rooms were tiny, but we expected this because it is in a historic building. The beds were extremely comfortable. Free Wifi was nice. Continental Breakfast was free and EXCELLENT. Above all the price was very good at $90 a night. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE for those wanting safe clean friendly accom”
Reviews.Author: winpig
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in early Nov.2011. The key is simply great value. Pros.... Great price,great location for this walking city,easy to walk to any of the action on Robson or nearby downtown,Super clean recently renovated room,Flat screen with cable worked well. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, If you prefer to spend your travel $ on exploring and eating and not on sitting in your room looking at your "view" this is one of the best choices in this wonderful city I know so well. Cons.... In an area generally considering "undesirable" ( but slowly gentrifying and close to high end areas), Street scene a little "funky" ( a few homeless beggars close by) However I never once felt in danger night or day.Inside hotel security seemed excellent. Its an old building that has been renoavated so its a bit creaky walking the long corridors. Perfect for younger world travelers or retired geezers traveling for fun. Had trouble getting my ipod touch to pick up wifi in the room but it worked well in the excellent coffee shop next door full of friendly international adventure travelers and the locals who seem to be student types mostly. All the best Bill.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: Visit0r2011
Reviews.Content: We just completed a five-night stay at this gem of a hotel. I must acknowledge, even after reading so many positive reviews prior to our booking, that I expected less. First, and foremost, the staff are phenomenal; from the phone call minutes after checking in to see if everything in the room met with approval to the pleasant banter on each coming and going, the atmosphere was professional and friendly. The room was super clean. The location is fantastic for downtown shopping and for exploring the historic neighbourhood. It is also very accessible to transit--both the Waterfront Station and various bus routes. When we return to Vancouver, this is definitely to be our hotel of choice. This really is one time when the 'too good to be true' is in actuality better than expected. Thank you, Ramada Limited Downtown, for a superlative experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: fran h
Reviews.Content: My son and I arrived at the hotel a little after 10a.m to ask if we could store our luggage as we were on foot. The hotel staff were very helpful and offered us our room to settle in. I also asked if we could have a cot delivered to our room as I had a last minute guest arriving. The staff were great, and delivered the cot within a very short time. All of our interactions with the hotel staff was very positive and enjoyable. The hotel is old but quaint, and extremely clean. Breakfast is your typical continental, but does have hot options. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again !”
Reviews.Author: HARDBATTLE
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in so many Ramada hotels, all have been very good, but this old really lets the hotel line badly down. We initally booked as it loked to be a very nice and old style hotel and we thoght it wold have character - the front hall and desk looked ok. Oh before this the valet parker said he could take the car and the charge is 25 dollars a day, being on a main road and not knowing the area we could only agree as we were messing with luggage and the passing traffic. Had we looked diagnally across the street we would have seen we could have parked ourselves for 10.50 a day. Oh well, never mind. We were shown to room, not what we expected. The door almost touched the bed, the space was the same at the other side, small high windows looking over rooftops and the docks. Extremely dim light bulbs, we have used energysavers for a while, but this abused the privilage ! I could not see colours of our cothes and the bed was a total nightmare, so so uncomfortable, neither of us slept much at all. We could hear guests getting ice from the machine which was 8 rooms away. The guests in the rooms next to ours could well have been sharing our room we could hear everything. We left the next morning although we had booked for 3 nights. I would avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly staff and reasonable prices (Carla from Brazil)”
Reviews.Author: CarlaJF_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed 26 nights in Ramada Limited Downtown and I recommend it without hesitation. The location was perfect for me, everything I needed was nearby (restaurants, shops, bus stops to every place in the city, and also Canada Line, Sky train and sea bus just two blocks away from the hotel, at the Water Front Station. As I stayed for almost a month, I was given a discount which made all the difference in my budget, and I was offered one of the best bedrooms. The staff was simply lovely, they really took care of me, as I was on my own and didn't know much on how to get to most places, they were always willing to help me. They did everything to make my stay enjoyable, comfortable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: stayed here for when the canucks LOST the stanley cup. had a really small room but it had a big flat screen. the tv had a volume control though so we could barely hear the game. the bathroom was a nice size and was almost as big as the room!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price, and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Jillford299
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hotel 5 times now, and not once have I been disappointed. One thing that anyone who may think of booking should bear in mind is that they keep their staff, which indicates to me that there is a good management. Continental breakfast is included, and the Hotel is conveniently positioned for Waterfront Station. I intend visiting Vancouver again (got back to UK on October 28th 2011) and I really would not stay anywhere else. Staff there go that extra mile, it's more like visiting friends, yet professional friends..........

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay until check out”
Reviews.Author: Ron G
Reviews.Content: booked online for one night had a wonderful stay at the hotel that is until check out time they felt a need to point out several times the rate I got was extremely low for that time of year (i booked online on their website)at first it made me feel good that I got a great deal but the fact that this was pointed out to me several times made it sound like I was somehow ripping them off and one point the woman doing the check out said I would never get that price again ! well thank you Ramada for turning on your customer .I booked on your website it gave me the price so dont treat me like a criminal .

Reviews.Title: “YAY for great service, a comfy bed, good shower & central location!”
Reviews.Author: AWC886
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights w/my BF & it was great from the outset: I'm an Entertainment Card user so was able to book @ 20% off w/no-fee/penalty cancellation, mentioned we were repeat customers & requested a room on the top floor, facing away from the street. Check-in was a breeze & we were pleasantly surprised to find ourselves in a room w/a gorgeous, unobstructed NE view through 2 windows (which opened)! The bed was super comfy w/4 fluffy pillows & the bathroom has a shower-over-tub w/nice toiletries & a curved curtain rod so no icky curtain sticking to you as you shower/bathe! Also, the water was quick to heat, there were several nozzle settings & the water pressure was very good + consistent. The in-room wifi was strong & didn't drop at all. The location is 2.5 blocks from Waterfront station, the terminus station of the Canada Line Skytrain direct from YVR airport, which makes arriving here very convenient. Also, several bus lines run right in front of the hotel & many other lines run on adjacent streets. There's literally no need for a car if you stay here, altho they do offer a valet service & there's many parking lots nearby. In the vicinity you'll find a plethora of banks, coffee shops, convenience stores, Pacific Centre mall & an endless variety of food offerings from $1 pizza to high end fine dining. This hotel is a gem for its price & location alone! One of the best things about our stay, however, was that the night before checkout, as we had to leave @ 5:30am the next morning, we asked the lady @ the front desk whether there might be a chance to get a little breakfast pack to go as we would be leaving much earlier than the breakfast room opened. She said she would look into it & get back to us. A few minutes later, she rang our room to say she'd made up some breakfasts for us. My BF went down to get them and it was absolutely amazing! We were honestly expecting something simple like PB&J sandwiches but in fact she'd packed us each a juice box, 2 types of muffins (I got cranberry & blueberry, yum!), a savoury bagel w/butters & cream cheese, apples & cutlery! This was definitely above & beyond anything we'd expected. My one niggle, and to be fair it's not the hotel's fault, is that one night when it was quite warm & I had the window opened a crack, there was some noise which carried up from the street of some people enjoying the weekend. However, once the window was shut & curtains drawn there wasn't an issue. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hugeabbafan
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay back at this hotel. The only thing I was disappointed with was, a few months back I requested a certain room (the one which I had on previous visit), however when I arrived, I was allocated another room with no windows - this was the only problem I had with the room. I was offered another room the next day but wanted to unpack that night therefore not prepared to move. I still was dissapointed with the fact that my request could have been adhered to seeing it was months ago. Otherthan that, I would stay again. As on other reviews, I do think air freshners along the room corridors are needed .....

Reviews.Title: “Nice location at a decent rate”
Reviews.Author: KrisBosma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the city center and main shopping street. Public transport is nearby and it includes a free continental breakfast. The rooms are somewhat outdated, but that also gives it an own vibe. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Anywhere Else In Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: 7heory
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best and most affordable hotel in Downtown Vancouver. I've stayed 3 times, making it 4 in December. I literally, WONT stay anywhere else. You can't find a more convenient hotel if you're staying downtown, walking distance from anything and everything. With Waterfront station a 5 minute walk away; you can literally, get, anywhere. The staff were all amazing, loved the layout of the hotel. Rooms were always nice, air conditioning always works. I work in the hotel industry, and I definitely can say the service is better then you'll find almost anywhere. I've recommended this place to anyone I know that has gone to Vancouver, and I will continue to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Value and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: cdn_camtravel
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of it's proximety to Canada Place. The staff were friendly, and the hotel was very clean. The room is smaller than expected, but was still easy for two people to manouvre. The king size bed was clean and very comfortable. You could see the plumbing and window frames were newer and the hotel is well cared for. This is a perfect hotel if you are taking the Canada Line from YVR and/or needing to get to Canada Place. I'm planning on going back to Vancouver just to see the city and I will definately be staying here. Oh, the breakfast area isn't horribly classey, but it's clean and if you happen to get there when it's not busy, it gets you some food and fresh coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: margiehovey
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel close to Cruise ships and train station.(We came in on a ship and left on a train) Rooms small but very comfortable, well furnished with period furniture. Very clean. Good bar and grill right next door. Hotel has hot breakfast which we didn't get to enjoy as we left at 5am. Hotel called taxi for us to train station. Also let us use breakfast room for private party with wine and champagne that we supplied. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: shadea1
Reviews.Content: Great location! Blocks to Gas Town and cruise terminal. Take Red and Blue Trolley trips. Staff was excellent! Rooms are small but clean. Breakfast was good. Not a luxury hotel... We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable close to DT”
Reviews.Author: GregandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our 7 night alaskan cruise - a brief 5 min walk from the cruise terminal and easy walking distance to Gastown and the Downtown area of granville street. Very comfortable, helpful staff, great simple breakfast spread included. Definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs a lot of work”
Reviews.Author: bhaber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and couldn't get out of the hotel faster. The room was exceptionally small, and wasn't well kept either. The entire place felt really dirty, from the floors to the furniture, and the bathroom walls were either falling apart or had some mold growing. The room was also quite dark, and had an depressing feeling overall. Our stay did include a breakfast, which was decent, but certainly not what we would have hoped. The elevators were also broken during out stay, so we lugged our suitcases up and down when we arrived and left. The staff at the hotel was friendly and they had free Internet, but those were the only two positives. Next time we'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and handy location”
Reviews.Author: EUReviewer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in the space of a two week trip around British Columbia. The hotel was perfect for a comfortable place to stay in a good location, close to all the city centre attractions. During our first stay, we were on the second floor but during the second stay we were on the sixth and the lift was out of service the whole time - this wasn't too much of an issue as it meant we could work up an appetite and then exercise off all our meals! The hotel also allowed us to watch films free of charge for the inconvenience. The rooms weren't awfully big but were a good enough size and clean with a compact bathroom. The beds were ever so comfortable and made for a perfect night's sleep. What is more, a breakfast buffet is provided in the room rate, which means you can have a light start to the day from an ample selection of breads, pastries, jams, cereals, coffee and juices. Some of the previous reviews have suggested that the hotel is in a dodgy area, but this was no more the case than in any other major city. The locale did not feel dangerous or intimidating at any time (even waiting on a taxi at 4am). I would definitely consider returning to this hotel on a future visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Timtam50
Reviews.Content: Good location, easy walking distance to downtown, China Town and bus and train stations. Our room was very small but the bed was very comfortable and it was quiet. Staff super helpful with tourist information and suggestions. We had a problem with our hot water and it was fixed within 10 minutes. Highly recommended as great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelExotica
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is that it provides affordable accommodation in the heart of downtown Vancouver. Most of the major attractions are within walking distance, although a hotel slightly more closer (perhaps two or three blocks)in the direction of Stanley park would have been perfect. The staff is great(typical Canadian warmth) and helps you with all inquiries. The valet parking is quite expensive but then you can do much about it if you wish to stay in downtown. The rooms are neat and clean, but slightly small. our room was on a higher floor and provided good views - one should try and request for upper floors in advance. During our stay the elevator stopped working but the staff did everything to help us, including providing free porter service. The breakfast room is quite small but the breakfast itself is quite filling. Overall, we had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Garj
Reviews.Content: For the money, it was a good buy. Rooms adequate in size (not overly large), bed very comfortable and shower powerful and hot. All staff very friendly. On 6th floor and found it one of the quietest hotels ever slept in! Area convenient for restaurants, Skytrain, Gastown and waterfront - perhaps not most upmarket area but only really non-threatening homeless people around. Easy to get to by public transport from the airport. Would recommend for a Vancouver stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but be aware of the area”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: We thought that this hotel was quite charming thanks to the character building it's located in. Although the hotel is very old, it's very well maintained inside (not so much on the outside). When we checked in, a very friendly receptionist greeted us and gave us some pointers on what to do in the city, which really made our day (and our stay). We were quite lucky to get a room with a view and some natural light, as I heard that many of this hotel's rooms have very dark rooms... The breakfast included a couple of hot items each morning and things like muffins, bagels, cereals and even porridge. The hotel had an ice machine, although it was located on the 5th floor instead of ground floor, which was slightly odd. We really had to be patient with the hotel's lift. It takes ages to move from one floor to another, so you can't really got anywhere in a hurry. But if you are not too posh to walk, take the stairs and you will get to wherever you are going much faster :-). Now the only real downside of this hotel is the area it's located in. We thought it was very seedy and full of homeless people and junkies. Not very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good location but don't expect a big room or a view”
Reviews.Author: imagardener
Reviews.Content: Reviews are accurate, hotel is close to bus transit and cabs can be called by pressing a button on room phone or asking at lobby desk. Employees are universally pleasant even in face of adversity (elevator was not working and there are 6 floors yikes). Thankfully we arrived early enough to get a 2nd floor room, windows opened (nice) to an airshaft meh. Very comfy bed. Carpet needs replacing. Nice clean bathroom. Breakfast is sausage, eggs and the usual rest. Fridge and micro is available for $15 day by request but not a lot of room for it (we skipped it). Jagger's is the gastropub next door, don't be put off by the external, inside it is very pleasant, well-run (unrowdy) and it has a fantastic menu to suit beer-drinkers or gourmets. Duck confit sandwiches, ribs, salmon sandwich, very above the average at reasonable prices. Very nice after a long day exploring Vancouver where you can walk your legs off. After the first day we used cabs from Point A to Point B.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - right near the metro”
Reviews.Author: Diving_Ace
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! The breakfast was also good which was served on the basement/ground floor. The location was great as it was a few minutes walk from the metro PLUS a short walk from the shopping district!! It was also close to the harbour and also to the famous clock towere in the Gas Town neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great prices for location”
Reviews.Author: Bystander53
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 16 nights in April/May 2011. Staff were very friendly, room was great (could have been a better view, though, for such a long stay). It's also a great location, nearby skytrain and Canada line stations as well as ferry terminal across to North Van. The buffet breakfast became tiresome after the first week but is perfectly adequate. I'd definitely consider this hotel again when I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position.”
Reviews.Author: Traceyvan-2324
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. The rooms are small but the position is great. They were clean. They staff were very helpful. Continental Breakfast was supplied. Would definately stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “We loved it for practical reasons and it was beyond our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: AileeSingapore
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its convenience after our Alaskan Cruise. Was checked into a small twin single beds on the quiet side of hotel. Thought the beds were a little small for our comfort as we were spoilt all the way on Cosmos Tour to the Canadian Rockies. On this tour, no meals were provided (only on optional tours) but all the hotels were really comfortable and has big single beds which they called double singles. Sometime we were put in suites too. We asked the hotel manager, Mr Eng if we could have the bigger room which have double singles. He readily agreed, no questions asked and no extra charge. Obviously we were glad. The hotel has a self laudrymate which is usefull. I used it except for some clever chap who could not wait for his turn and came and took out my laundry. I waited around for the drying, again he was there before me and took out my washings. I saw his load which consist of ladies wear and undergarment!!!. I was thinkiing what kind of a man would do his partner's washings. In the east, it is considered 'not so lucky' to do women's undergarment. No wonder he turned out to be like that. Also inclusive was the morning breakfast which is in the basement of the hotel and was sufficient for us. Quite a bit of people around in the morning but the turnover was quick so we do not feel the smallnes of the room but rather the cosiness of it. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially when I spoke dialect with them. Best of all the hotel offer free internet services to their client. Other big hotels will charge but not this. This helped as I could be in touch with my son in London and my daughter back home. I would definitely want to stay in this hotel again. Thank you Mr Eng and his staff. Kudos to you all. Keep well and take care.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: BeverlyHS
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for three nights prior to an Alaska cruise. It was clean and nice. Rooms were small but how long are you in your hotel room? No view at all, a brick wall next door. The area was fine. I never felt unsafe. Breakfast was good. Very easy to get to this hotel from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable quality, reasonable stay, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: couldconnect
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. I found the reception area small but very modernized despite the old age of the building. All of the front staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. Though, if you do check in very late at night, the front doors are locked to the lobby. The room I stayed in was very modernized with windows that opened and a view to the habour. The room had a bit of an odour but such is expected when there is no forced air system. Instead, each room has its own fan/AC unit, which is noisy but works well. The linens were clean, the bedding was clean, and the bathroom was clean. The furnishings and bathroom have all been upgraded and decent to use. Room service very good in cleaning every day. The lighting in the room was sufficient. I could not hear any noise from adjoining rooms, which is great. As part of the stay, breakfast is included. Breakfast is very simple with pre-made pancakes and eggs. There's toast and cereal. Though, not many options for vegetarians. Breakfast area is definitely small and can get crowded at times. Location is awesome. Pender Street has excellent bus access to many places in Vancouver and close to train access.

Reviews.Title: “clean and "basic" downtown hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hawksfansince1976
Reviews.Content: The reception and check in was smooth and no hassles or problems encountered, lobby area is smallish and "basic", the lobby has the free internet computer to the left of the front desk for guest use, the breakfast is downstairs and was buffet style, (basic items nothing too crazy or fancy) the room itself seemed kind of smallish and a bit cramped but it is an older hotel so you're paying less than some other places downtown. Okay , most all of them. Slight smell of mustiness was around but not bad. Parking was a hassle I thought as the parking IS NOT actually at or under the hotel, it is in a separate area that you must have a bellman go with you so that he may unlock the main gate so that you can get into your car (even if just for one or two minutes to get something). Not the quietest hotel on the inside but it IS close to restaurants and shops and stuff to do.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Ramada but adequate and reasonably priced...”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: To begin with, I agree with most reviews here that Ramada Limited Vancouver is not situated at the best location of town, BUT it really is not that bad. I guess it all depends on what part of the world people are from and what type of neighborhood you are comfortable with. The east side of Vancouver downtown, while some people consider it "sketchy" or "seedy", is really far less dangerous compare to the bad parts of some other big cities like New York, Los Angeles, Chicago or even San Francisco. Yes you do see a few homeless people but more you noticed is the shops and restaurants around this area so it is not a major disturbance. I spent a couple days at this hotel after a week of conference and walked around this area day and night, never even felt unsafe once. In fact, I consider the location of this hotel quite convenient as it is within walking distance to the Convention Center (about 3.5 blocks southeast at Richards) and close proximity to Gastown, Chinatown and even Yaletown. Now about the hotel. Ramada Limited is operated from within a historical building so facility wise, it is no surprise to me this property is a bit old but overall I must say Ramada did a pretty okay job renovating the premise. My room is bit on the crammed side especially with a big bed in the middle (which takes up 60+% of the space) but otherwise clean and considered comfortably furnished. Bathroom looked fresh as well. I do wish Ramada can do without the bulky armoire and put in a LCD tv but generally speaking I really can't fault much about the facility - it is neither new or modern but definitely OK. Service wise, on the other hand, is quite good. Staff is friendly and do try to help in every occasion. Rate is also quite reasonable considering free internet and breakfast (OK selection) are included. I saw quite a few tour groups and senior citizens checking in and out during my two-day stay there so I assume this is a preferred property for many tourists. Overall, I would rate this hotel pleasant but nothing really special. If I return to Vancouver and choose Ramada again, I will more likely select the Ramada Downtown on Granville as that is a much better renovated property and price is totally comparable. But if you are in Vancouver for conference and need to pick a reasonably priced hotel close to everything in downtown, Ramada Limited is truly not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again if ......”
Reviews.Author: MobileEm
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th and last accommodation (mix of hotel and BnB, second Ramada) in a seven weeks trip. As an older solo female traveller I often felt I was given less consideration than couples and groups. Hence when I yet again got the noisiest room in the house, instead of accepting it as I had in other places, I complained bitterly. I felt I'd done more than my fair share. I was told the hotel was full and I couldn't be moved. (Possibly true on account of the Stanley Cup.) Next morning I complained again and was referred to the duty manager. My room was changed at that point to a room on a higher floor at the back of the hotel. This was satisfactory although it was lucky I was awake when two men started conversing outside my door on my first morning in that room. It's unreasonable to expect the hotel to be able to do much about inconsiderate guests until they get to the really loud party stage. Unfortunately. Both rooms were more than adequate for size and desk space for computer use. Both had tea/coffee but not fridge or microwave. Both had good sized bathrooms with shower over bath. The room I finished up in (606) had a weird electrical connection. The bedside lamp and the light outside the bathroom were somehow connected. If you turned off the bedside lamp the other light stayed on. At that point you don't feel like leaping out of bed to turn off another light. I fixed this by plugging the bedside lamp into another socket - luckily the cord reached far enough. Breakfast was 'standard ramada' - adequate but not exciting. I would only stay here again if I had made my needs known before booking and the hotel agreed to supply what I wanted, basically one of the quieter rooms. Be aware that all _14 rooms face the street on one side and on the other you are three steps from the elevator with the attendant inconsiderate noisy guests and the clatter of rolling luggage entering and exiting the elevator, especially early check-outs. The location is excellent. Anyone afraid of this "seedy neighbourhood" (it's not) should consider staying home rather than travelling.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel but request a higher level room”
Reviews.Author: discoveringtheworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located a ten minute walk from the Downtown train station. We stayed for two nights at the beginning of our Canada trip. We were given a small dark room (310), with a window which barely opened and had a brick wall behind it, hence the reason it was so dark. The bathroom was quite large with a large plastic shower enclosure instead of a bath. The first night we stayed there were people in the room next to us who kept us awake all night as the walls are paper thin and we could hear every word possible; they weren’t making any attempt to be quiet either. I had to put the television on quietly in the background to try to balance out their noise. The second night I don’t think there was anyone in the room next door, but we had a similar problem with the people in the room above. Our room rate included breakfast which was taken in the basement area. This consisted of toast, preserves, egg and pancakes, cereal, fruit juices some small cakes and a couple of pieces of fruit. Staff were friendly and helpful, happy to offer advice on the local area. The hotel corridors themselves smell very musty and are in general need of modernising but it was ideal for us with its location and reasonable price. We stayed again at this hotel for the end of our trip and this time were given a room on the 5th floor, room 506. This room was like a completely different hotel (except the musty smell in the corridors), with 2 large windows which in the far distance you could see towards the dock. This room was much larger and whilst it had the same decor as the room we had previously stayed in, the natural light made it feel alot nicer. We were also able to have the windows open properly. It was however quite noisy and we were awaken at 6AM by noises coming from outside the hotel, it sounded like big dustcarts or something and went on for a good hour. Despite the checkout time being 12PM, housekeeping start banging on doors at 8AM so we were then woken again. Normally we would be up by this time having breakfast but as we had a late night flight back to London we wanted a bit of a lie in. As it was pouring with rain I called Reception to see if we could keep the room until 4pm so that we could head out into the City but then return for a quick shower before we had to make our way to the airport. I was told we couldn’t keep the room but they would give us another one for $100. Personally I thought this was disgusting, $100 for 4 hours, it wasn’t as though the hotel were busy, they could have offered us the room for an extra 4 hours no charge especially given how poor the weather was. They were however able to offer us storage for our luggage so we could go out in the day without dragging it around with us. Overall I would say this hotel is ideal for a flyby visit to Vancouver but request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Iffy”
Reviews.Author: llhcpa
Reviews.Content: We were just looking for a place to sleep a couple of nights as we were out touring both days we were there. As others have stated, this hotel is in a really close to the ship terminal and Gastown. However, it's really in a seedy area; I'm not sure I would recommend that anyone stay there without a male escort. Our room did not have a window that opened and the air conditioner was right next to one bed, so that person would get frozen if it was left on all night. The staff was lovely and very helpful. The decor of the room was fine and they had free wifi. If the surrounding area was better I would rate it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: marks611
Reviews.Content: This Historic hotel is in a great location for the Canada Place cruise terminal and Sky Train Station - Waterfront - all within walking distance or if the weather is bad a taxi costs under C$7 including tip. Also within walking distance for the Hop On Hop Off Vancouver Trolley tour and Gas Town and shops. Just around the corner is the Outlook, a saucer shape on top of a sky scrapper with a 360 degree view of the mountains, harbour and downtown Vancouver. This hotel made us feel very welcome and it is well maintained with very clean comfortable rooms. Modern bathrooms with great showers and hairdryers. Freshly cooked hot food for breakfast with cereal, bread, bagels and muffins on offer as well as juice and fresh fruit. The staff are very friendly and helpful and had answers to all our questions. The free wifi in the rooms was great so we could keep in touch with home. Some rooms have no view but a frosted window into a central courtyard. This let in adequate light and ventilation and we didn't mind this. Friends joined us at this hotel and we stayed pre and post cruise having different rooms each time so 4 different rooms were used at this hotel during our visit to Vancouver. We enjoyed our time at the Ramada Limited Downtown and would return and can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mjhannah77
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay at this hotel! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was great for my meetings and leisure time. The hotel is walking distance to all you can need in Downtown Vancouver and anything not in walking distance is very accessible by transit. The rooms were very comfortable and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Taylorzinha
Reviews.Content: Two of my colleagues and I stayed at the Ramada Limited Downtown Vancouver while attending a conference held at two other hotels. The location of this hotel was perfect! It was close to all the great downtown spots: Gastown, Yaletown, Granville St, Vancouver Convention Center, the waterfront; close to several great restaurants; close to the conference site; and at no time did we ever feel unsafe. Vancouver is a city so of course some dirt, poverty, homelessness, and pollution are to be expected! The room we were in was great--it seemed newly remodeled and the bathroom was larger than we expected and there was working WiFi at all times. The lobby and common areas were always were clean and the front desk agents acknowledged us every time we passed by. Breakfast is simple but serves its purpose. Some of our colleagues stayed at the conference hotels and were very disappointed by the service and facilities of those hotels while we were extremely pleased with ours. The only downside were the seagulls waking us early in the morning but there's nothing the hotel could do about that. This hotel is an excellent value and I will definitely stay there again if I ever return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: rosners
Reviews.Content: Pretty basic hotel in slightly seedy area of downtown Vancouver. Rooms were small, only just adequate. One non-openable window onto an internal wall where pigeons had their daily meeting around 5am didn't help the sleep quality. Breakfast included in windowless basement. Everything just about average and most of staff were nice enough except for the front desk night-manager who was exceptionally unfriendly. There are definitely better options.

Reviews.Title: “awsome value! awsome service! parking...expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMikey
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the hotel while I was in town for my company conference. The ramada limited is centrally located to everything thats worth seeeing in downtown vancouver. The casino, the convention center, shopping district, movies, everything. The staff was great. I cant wait to return, vancouver is such a beautiful city. Great breakfast too! I just wish parking wasnt so expensive....

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: rcwant2be
Reviews.Content: Small but cozy rooms. Updated decor is nice. Our room was behin the elevator & we could feel & hear the vibrations it made with every trip. Free breakfast is good but I saw a mouse in the breakfast room. Still, would recommend. Easy to get to from skytrain, under $100 & near the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location , comfortable beds , read review”
Reviews.Author: blakeh1313
Reviews.Content: For 80 bucks a night, I was a little worried, we have a lot of shows this month, so we downgraded to a less expensive hotel. The actual location is slightly scary, but you are literally 3 blocks from Georgia, which makes it super convenient, we were going to The Q.E.T. so it was a 600m walk If you are a middle aged woman, who has no sense of adventure , and want to be pampered, don't stay here. You should already know that, by the word " limited " in the title, this isn't the hotel for you. If you are a concert goer, hockey fan, or a busy vacationer, who plans to actually " live " on your vacation, this is the hotel for you. If you are planning on hanging out in your hotel all day, I don't recommend it. However, secure floors, super comfortable king bed, great water pressure, and a free breaky is your idea of what you want in a hotel, the Ramada Limited is for you. Even a huge storage room for you to lock up your stuff the next day, for day trips, after check out. My wife and I even had the opportunity to help out a guy , having a hard time with the slush in his wheelchair, and an older woman caught up in the snow. Sometimes, seeing the world from the opposite side of the street can enhance your holiday. And if you like quality food , check out Gorilla vegan raw foods around the corner, for a nice healthy veggie lunch !

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: leep1934
Reviews.Content: Because we were taking HAL's Repositioning cruise - Vancouver-Hawaii-San Diego, I chose a reasonably priced hotel within easy taxi distance to Canada Place Cruise Terminal, even within walking distance if necessary. We lucked out with brilliant Sept 30 - Oct 2 weather. The view from the plane of Vancouver at twilight was absolutely spectacular. What a gorgeous city. Our bag showed up (not headed to Cancun as on a previous flight to Vancouver) and our taxi fare to the Ramada Limited Downtown on Pender St was about $50. It was dark by our arrival time and there were 2 or 3 rather seedy looking characters lying about in doorways near the hotel, which was slightly disconcerting, but they ignored us. (This hotel is not in a bad area, but sadly, like many other large cities, Vancouver seems to have quite a few seemingly homeless younger men [some women] and they loiter about requesting handouts in many tourist areas of the city.) The reception clerk was friendly and efficient. We were nicely welcomed, given the keys to our room, and took the elevator (where the guest must insert the room key to get the elevator to move) to the 3rd floor and settled down for a long night's sleep. The room was small, but quite adequate for our needs. Both the bedroom and bathroom were clean, the sheets and towels were crisp and clean, in good condition and our room was very quiet. Because of jet lag we were wide awake by 5 AM and enjoyed the room's coffee maker. Breakfast in the lower level was served at 6 AM and turned out to be quite amazing. There were real glass glasses, real pottery cups, real, heavy duty silverware, real plates. One didn't even have to bus. The breakfast room hostess was very friendly, helpful and efficient. The food choices were similar to other moderately priced hotels, but with real orange juice, as well as bananas, apples, yogurt, bagels, cereal, toast, hard boiled eggs, a hot egg/sausage dish, donuts etc. What we found most impressive with this almost 100 year old hotel was the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. A request to remove an overstuffed chair which kind of blocked our closet entrance, was immediately taken care of. From breakfast hostess, to desk clerks, to housekeeping staff, it was a happy experience for us to be there. This Ramada Limited Downtown is by no means high luxury, and the rooms are small, but it is very clean, graciously and efficiently run, and extremely convenient. Were we ever to visit Vancouver again, we wouldn't hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in cozy and clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sailorgal999
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. Given the area and that the hotel was older, we were expecting to have a roof over our head and average accommodation. We found the hotel to be very charming and cozy. And CLEAN. The room sizes were smaller, but that wasn't unexpected. The rooms had everything and updated furnishings and fixtures. The beds were amazingly comfortable. The only complaint was the pigeons which seemed to stay active all through the night, but glancing outside the window the hotel did try to deter them by many methods. Staff were friendly and helpful, guiding us to local venues. The breakfast area was clean and comfortable, coffee good, breakfast adequate for continental. We were very happy with our stay and this will be our new place to stay when we visit down town.

Reviews.Title: “Should be rater higher on TA”
Reviews.Author: Samtoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers good value for you money. Location - only 3 short blocks from Waterfront station. The location is quite safe. Good public transport nearby (i.e. #19 to Stanley Park). Room - on the small side but the bed is super comfortable. Quiet and clean room. We particularly liked the fact that the window in the room opens. Internet - free! Good wireless connection. Breakfast - complimentary. Solid breakfast items (bagel, pancakes, toast, muffins, cereals, juice, coffee/tea). We would have liked to see yogurt and more fresh fruit. Overall, we were quite happy with our stay (3 nights). We paid USD 72 per night which we thought was a bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Jhus63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well situated for a city break with everything within walking, public transport distance and only a short walk to Gas Town. The rooms were nothing special but were clean and comfortable. The basement complementary breakfast room was a great plus with staff on hand to clean, clear and keep the coffee, juice, pancakes, cereal and toast supply going.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: SRohde
Reviews.Content: While I am not a person that needs a Ritz or Hilton hotel, I do like my hotels to be safe and clean, and I am pretty picky about the clean aspect of things. I thought this hotel was amazing. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, the breakfast was adequate, and the location and price were great. My husband and I had never been to Vancouver before and decide to stay downtown. I was thrilled with the hotel, the rooms I thought were spacious enough considering the historic nature of the property, and I never felt like we were in a seedy or bad area like others have noted. I grew up in a town of only 2,000 people, and I didn't feel like I was in any sort of "dangerous situation" at all. My husband and I walked around outside at night and were fine. It was quiet, the hotel staff was very nice and helpful, and we were super pleased with our choice. If/when we come back to Vancouver, we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good,Clean,Cheap,”
Reviews.Author: nic1978bc
Reviews.Content: I was at this location in April 2010 and i found it was clean considering the date of the building, the interior surprisingly felt more recent. I did not have a view room there was a frosted window 2 feet from a brick wall but cheaper. Location The neigbourhood was shady after 8 pm but nothing to worry about if you are just heading back to your Hotel. Free Breakfast is ok . i think the overall experience is pleasing considering the price you pay .. I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location great breakfast host!”
Reviews.Author: Charliegirl211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. On our arrival we were welcomed and shown to our spacious rooms. We then went off and explored Vancouver when we returned we couldn't work out how to switch on the lights as the switch inside the door didn't turn anything on! We eventually worked out that the switch was not connected to anything and we had to switch on each lamp individually! We arrived on a friday and unfortunately on the first night we could here loud music until about 3am, it appeared to be coming from two different places. The rooms were generally clean and although we hung our towels to help 'save the planet!' they were replaced daily! And although there were only two of us there were enough towels for four people. The lady in the breakfast room was lovely and always made sure my husband had plenty of pancakes! She greeted us every morning with a smile and was very chatty, she made sure we had everything we needed and knew where things were. This hotel was very convenient for all we wanted to do and we managed to walk everywhere. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: mustangguy
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel, this time to see "Grease" at the Queen Elizabeth. It is very convenient and close to most downtown events. We booked on line and pre-paid to get the absolute best rate. I do not believe that $70 for a hotel in a major North American city could ever be considered expensive. The staff was very helpful and because we came in early from Vancouver Island on the bus, they actually put our bags in secure storage so we could walk around Vancouver with our backpacks. The staff is friendly, helpful and informative. This hotel is on the fringe of the "bad" parts of Vancouver but I am not intimidated by that. Every city has it's warts and we never had an issue at this hotel. We asked for a king bed which we got on the 6th floor. Our room was small bur people need to realize that this is a heritage building and subject to the constraints of that condition. The bathroom was huge and the hotel did not smell. Ignorant smokers in the elevator are just that and the hotel can do nothing about it. The breakfast is fine with a good selection. I will definitely stay here again as I like the character of this place. It reminds me of an older British hotel. The hotel could be a little quieter but like I said it is a heritage building and it is subject to restrictions in modifications.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MacPark82
Reviews.Content: I arrived here from Vancouver Airport using the fantastic Vancouver Skytrain. The downtown station "Waterfront Station" is a short 5 minute walk to the hotel and is 2 blocks in total. The clerk that checked me in was very friendly and helpful and explained everything I needed to know about breakfast times and how to connect to the hotels free wifi. I stayed in the standard room and when I entered the room had a bit of a musty smell and was a bit humid. I opened the window and everything was fine after about 5 minutes. Besides that, the room was basic but very cosey. It has a very old school european feel and considering the cheap rates of the room it was very nice. The bath room was very clean and I had a small problem with the toilet that was solved within 5 minutes by house keeping. The bed was the stand out of the whole room. Considering this is a low end hotel, the bed was very comfortable with great pillows that just soak you up. I slept very well. The hotel provides free breakfast that is all laid out for you to take as much as you want buffet style. They provide 2 hot items (for example pankakes) and you can have all the coffee,juice, bagels, toast, fruit, ceral ect. Considering that its free with your room I had no complaints. The location is downtown and right on the edge of the popular Gas down area. Many tourist and shopping areas are with in a short stroll in any direction. The location of the hotel was the hands down winner and I was very happy. If you like pizza you will love the location as there is so many choices within a few minutes walk. If you are after a budget option in a great area I would recomend this hotel to anyone. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value basic hotel in good location for Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: AirlineFreak
Reviews.Content: Attending an event at the Convention Centre, we were looking for some better value accommodation than the luxury hotels just across the street from the venue. The Ramada Limited turned out to be a good choice. Only a few blocks' walk and an ok standard. Rooms are nothing fancy and the bathroom could have impressed more, but you get what you pay for. Very friendly and helpful staff. The biggest downside was that the breakfast room was so small that it got really crowded during "rush hour" and one day, I even had to skip the hotel breakfast one day because I didn't have the time to queue.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Peteyh
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Ramada Limited Downtown hotel for almost two weeks. Just before our trip we read a few bad reviews here about the hotel and we got worried, but fortunately our fears were unfounded. The hotel turned out to be a very good one and I have to say we were very pleased with our hotel choice. First of all, the location is perfect! Everything is a short walk away, and the homeless people around the area didn't bother us because they weren't dangerous at all. Secondly, the staff was super nice all the time and every one of them from reception to house-keeping did their jobs well. When we needed help or information, we got it right away. Our room was very clean too, and there were no nasty smells or anything like some other reviewers claim to have experienced (which is really hard to believe). My only complaint is that the breakfast room is way too small! It's almost always so crowded and it was hard to enjoy our breakfast there. The breakfast itself, however, was more than satisfactory. It was great to start our days with full stomaches. Overall, if we come back to Vancouver someday, I would definitely re-book here. You cannot get a better location or friendlier staff in anywhere else, I'm quite certain of that. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jean31338
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of an Alaska cruise first week in October 2010. We were within easy walking distance of Gastown, Chinatown, the new Vancouver Public Library (an architectual gem), shopping, etc. We are seniors and are not long walkers and this location worked well for us. We did not feel the location was "seedy" as others had implied and would both stay again and recommend to friends. The staff were super friendly and helpful. One caveat--if it is important, specify a room with a window view, as ours was at the back and the window was opaque. But this was insignificant on a short 3 night visit.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: maggiem1947
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be dirty, with stained carpets in the hallways and rooms. The rooms are very small, and the lobby was small with no privacy. Valet parking only. Expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased with the hotel I chose”
Reviews.Author: hugeabbafan
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived which was quite early around 08.30am, I knew I would not be able to check in that early so was happy to go alone and get some breakfast elsewhere and came back at midday. As the room was not still ready I was offered coffee/tea and told that my room should be read soon, however, there was another room which was and I could have that one. It wouldn't be as nice I was advised so I waited. My room was on floor 6 - called the executive floor. Upon entering the room, I was more than plesantly surprised. Room with two windows overlooking the sea and where cargo is brought into the country, not noisy at all. Double bed, bathrobes, coffee/tea maker with fresh coffee and teabags, large bathroom with bathtub and shower, stone tiling. Very clean, no smells (like some reviews on here). Comfortable. I will confess with reading some reviews, I wasn't sure what type of room I was going to get (booked via Trip Advisor). The only slight grip I do have is the breakfast room (continential was incl). The room is far too small for the hotel size and the hotel seriously needs to look into this. When you go down there, it makes you want to go out for some breakfast instead. Overall, if and when I come back to Vancouver, I would re-book here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Cruises but not very clean”
Reviews.Author: sleepless55
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for cruise ship passengers. Close to Gastown, Seabus & Skytrain. Lots of foreign tourists. Free breakfast. Rooms and bathrooms are very small. Lobby is very small. Carpets are filthy! Valet Parking only. Not worth $170 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: chimaera001
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via a travel agent. To be fair, the location is great with regard to access to the rest of Downtown. However, the hotel is very tired, and there is a reason that is quite a bit cheaper than the rest of the local competition. I stayed for 5 nights, and had 5 rooms - the first was on the 2nd (European 1st) floor, facing the road, which I was concerned would be too noisy (room 215 - facing the main street) - I was then put into 210 which I was told would be quieter as it faced the side-street though it had no natural light. This room did not smell good, though was told that the next day they would try to move me to a higher floor. The next day I was moved to 410 - the same room two floors above. Whilst this did have natural light it also smelt bad - with a vineger tinge. I had asked for a double-bed, but all I got was two singles pushed together. The shower was a total joke, and breakfast in the morning wasn't impressive - in a tiny room in the basement with only bagels and pancakes as the hot options, and only maybe seating for 20-30 guests at most. With 80 rooms if you went at peak time there was no point as there was no room and nowhere to sit. Free Internet connectivity was good, though the connection slow. On checkout I wasn't even asked whether everything had been alright with my stay - I wouldn't bother even thinking about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Would never book there again”
Reviews.Author: boomdog
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel, thinking that the Ramada is a reputable hotel to stay in. When we opened the door to the room, we smelled a strong smell of urine. The carpet was so dirty that we wouldn't have even taken our shoes off and the bed was so soft that you could feel the coils when you sat on it. Needless to say, we didn't stay at the hotel. Instead, stayed at the Pinnacle Hotel on the Pier in North Vancouver, which I might add was amazingly beautiful and for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Room smelled like urine and feces”
Reviews.Author: jeanetteschick
Reviews.Content: Our room smelled like urine and feces upon entering. The hotel's response was to give us a can of spray air freshener. We could see a big stain on floor where someone had the accident. No other rooms available, so we had to stay. No one should have to live in those conditions, let alone pay. Hotel refused to discount room. Room was so small and cramped my husband and I had difficult time walking around without squeezing. It was awful experience. It is one of the cheaper hotels, but not worth it. Be warned, do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “we will definitely come back... really good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: adamsue
Reviews.Content: I am not over rating this hotel...but for me and my partner, this hotel is the best among the rest... great value for the money you'll spend... breakfast for both of us is really good. Amy, she is really nice and accommodating... she always welcomes guest with a big smile and will greet them with a good morning... (for me that is one of the most important thing, to start your day right, with great people and good food). Location wise, the hotel is really great... we just rode Canada line from the airport (fare is expensive in YVR terminus), off to waterfront station, and from there we just walked 2-3 blocks going to ramada. If you're in for walking... everything is just a walking distance from the hotel, name it! (Canada place, Robson square, Gas town, China town, Waterfront station). Our room is always clean, and we can say that the room attendant is doing their job well, because we stayed there for 5 days and boy! they cleaned our room really good. On our 3rd day we informed the attendant that our curtain was broken, they said that maintenance will come to fix it, and whoala! when we came back to our room, everything was clean and our curtain was already fixed, that's what you call fast and reliable service. =) We slept really good and we don't have any problems with noise or anything. By the way, we really did not expect this, because we arrived in Vancouver early at around 10am and the check in time is not until 3pm, we went in the hotel hoping to ask the clerk if we can just leave our luggage because we need to do something important that day, then, we were surprised that the front desk clerk told us that we can check in now because the room was already ready... WOW!!! =) and the other best part was that, from the other reviews they said that some of the rooms don't have windows, so here I am, asked the clerk if she can give us a room with window, and our wish is our command... she checked us in early, +++ she gave us a room with window... she is really nice and accommodating... =) the sad thing is, I forgot her name, but she is in the front desk when we checked in last june 7, I think she worked on the weekdays, tall lady with brown hair... really nice and friendly... =) Amy and her is really an asset in this hotel... =) Me and my partner missed Vancouver badly... and we are planning our next trip there, and in our plan, we will still stay in Ramada Limited Downtown Vancouver... =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTandRE
Reviews.Content: Was not planning on staying at this hotel but company booked me in last minute. Paul and Amanda were helpful at the desk and had a great suggestions about local restaraunts,knew the area, public transportation, and were very friendly. Rooms were quaint, but fresh and suited the style of hotel. The most shocking part of my stay was how quiet it was all night. Good value and walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Babby86
Reviews.Content: Everything about it is OK,Food,Cleanliness Staff,outdoor activity,rooms but GOOD breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deckhandoug
Reviews.Content: Very Convenient to Canada Place cruise terminal, Gastown, China town and the Granville street area. Staff are very friendly & helpful, providing us with personalized touruist maps of some good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: dtko
Reviews.Content: Bedding wonderful. Location perfect to cruise ships. We walked our luggage to the cruise terminal. Walking distance to restauants and shopping in Gas Town and Canada Place. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: pri_rigon
Reviews.Content: I recommend Ramada, because the location is very good (near the skytrain station and other transportations )all employees are very, very nice, always ready to help, and i had a very good time in there.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tr1pper
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. For the last 3 years My wife and I have been going to Whistler to ski/snowboard and on the day of arrival into Vancouver and the day before departure we stay at the Ramada Limited Downtown. Every yr the staff are great, and yes the rooms are small but if you leave your ski/board bags downstairs in the secure lock-up there is plenty of space in the room. I have never had any reason to complain about the rooms cleanliness on any of our stay's. The breakfast is nothing fancy but more than ample for the price point of the hotel. The location is fantastic and has my wife or myself ever felt uneasy walking around at night. We definitely will be staying there again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Laly1456
