Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures, not all rooms have a view, I stayed in a room with no windows, they had curtains but the window was taken out and covered with glass blocks. It was my husband, sister in law and myself in a room with 2 double beds, no sofa like they show in the picture and we couldn't fit 4 suitcases in the room, there is no storage place either. The breakfast is not continental and is in the basement. The street where is located is close to a lot of places but not in a neiboorhood where you can walk at night. I felt bad when a tour guide told us as we were getting off the bus not to go to the left, THAT'S WHERE OUR HOTEL WAS. You can find other hotels in the area for the same price. The other Ramada is very well located and the city tours busses stop at the door. At this hotel you have to walk 4 blocks to get to the city tours. NEVER AGAIN. Laly, Miami Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blackjud
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Downtown Vancouver for two nights with my daughter for a weekend of exploring Vancouver and some shopping. We were upgraded to the executive floor and had quiet although small room. It was very comfortable, the beds and pillows were great and everything was clean. The staff was very courteous and immediately looked up the opening hours of a store I was going to. The location is very convenient too, right downtown 5 min. from a major mall, Chinatown and the Waterfront station where a 25 min subway right from the airport takes you. Breakfast was sufficient too, eggs, pancakes, bagels, muffins, toast etc. Overall we had a great stay there and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value!”
Reviews.Author: oahulagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vancouver every year, and this was our first time staying here. We found a very attractive air/hotel deal online, and we read many online reviews about this hotel so we knew what to expect. We stayed for 12 nights so it would've been helpful if there were a microwave and fridge in room. Great services by staff, our booking included daily breakfast which was perfect for us, and location was great for our needs. Very close to Gastown, Chinatown, GM Place, Robson Street, Granville, etc. Building itself was old but kept clean, maid did a great job cleaning our room daily. Bed was comfortable, bathroom kept clean. Room was a bit of a smaller side for 2 of us with 2 suitcases and 2 snowboard bags. Valet staff & night shift front desk staff could be a bit friendlier. Parking is expensive but average for downtown hotels. Valet will take a while to get your car, so we recommend calling them from room prior to going down. We were fine walking back late at night, but would not recommend it to female traveling alone to walk back late at night, but that applies to anywhere in downtown. We were satisfied with our stay and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: butgighung
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, we stayed for 2 separate nights. The staff were friendly and helpful. Though the standard room is not big, it's nice and clean. Location is perfect. I especially like the services it provides; free wifi and breakfast which was way better than my expectation. It's really value for money. PS I have been reading the TA reviews as reference for many years. I feel quilty for not giving any reviews for other users. So I decided to share my experiences from now on. This is my first review! Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value for $ in Convenient Area”
Reviews.Author: bamboostar
Reviews.Content: My partner & I were a bit wary when we first booked the budget Ramada Limited Downtown as it was much cheaper than comparable options in town. Luckily, we were able to cast aside our misconceptions right away when we checked in to our clean, spacious and well-appointed room, which had a street view. The room was furnished with a tv (in its large stand), a small desk, an armchair + ottoman and a double bed with plenty of pillows. Importantly, the bathroom was spotless and full of the requisite towels and toiletries. The free WiFi connection is a big bonus. There was no problem with the connection in our room, which was several floors up. The included continental breakfast is also quite nice. The selection is not elaborate but it is superior to many other included breakfasts at other budget hotels. Options included instant oatmeal, various dried cereals with milk, freshly brewed coffee, bananas, apples, bagels, muffins and toast. This hotel was within walking distance to many popular attractions like Chinatown and Robson St. There are buses that run right outside of the hotel and a Skytrain stop just a few blocks away too. When I return to Vancouver again, I will likely stay at the Ramada Limited Downtown as it provides excellent value and convenience in a fairly expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great value, but somewhat seedy area”
Reviews.Author: North_Van_Family
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older style building decorated to a high and modern standard inside. Hotel has valet only parking and not convenient to drop of bags as the lane outside is a clearway. First impressions on entering are good. Reception staff very friendly and efficient. Lobby is a little small and so it could get busy at peak times. There is only one elevator carrying only about 6 adults comfortably. Rooms have standard amenities and free wireless internet which was welcome, although connection dropped occasionally. Bathroom style is more classic, clean and comfortable. A fridge and microwave can be rented at $15/day or $50/stay. Note that some rooms have no view as they face a wall. We were a little surprised to discover this and that it was not mentioned anywhere. After a couple of nights and cabin fever set in, we managed to get moved to a room with a view which was far better. The hotel is set in a safe but lively area. It is on the border of a less desirable part of town. There are a couple of homeless shelters and hostels in the area, making it buzz a little at night. Some of the loiterers are more of a nuisance than a danger, but my partner got harassed every time she went out which bugged her quite quickly. There is no restaurant, but Yagers bar next door provided a good range of bar drinks and lighter snacks which were delicious and good value. You get a 10% discount on production of your Ramada key. Breakfast is included with this hotel which is one of the best value hotels in Vancouver. If you're driving then you need to find overnight parking. Secure valet parking is available but is quite expensive. There are some public (non secure) car parks available for overnighters but this can add up. This is an older hotel which has ever basic comfort and most importantly friendly and professional staff. If on an overnight then the rooms without view would be ok but only if you're arriving at night and leaving early. Otherwise make sure you get a room facing the street, preferable facing North or West which are the quietest. South facing rooms are the noisiest. Great to see that you still get good service AND value, and not a bad location at all. Free basic breakfast just sets this apart from other budget hotels in the area. Well done Ramada

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Downtown and GM Place”
Reviews.Author: mustangguy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel ages ago for my stepsons 19th birthday gift to the Canucks game. I read the reviews both good and bad and must say that we were not dissappointed with this hotel. We got off the bus #257 at Dunsmuir and Cambie from the West Vancouver ferry terminal and it is just a short walk down Cambie and left on West Pender. I was a little unsure about the area at first as it is not the "best" part of Vancouver. However we walked around in the daytime and at night and had zero problems. The streets are alive with people for a Thursday but this could have been due to the hockey crowd. The room is smallish but the beds are very comfortable. The room was clean as was the bathroom. The hotel smelled clean and fresh. Our room was able to be heated or cooled adequately to my liking. The front desk was polite and helpful. To be honest for a city like Vancouver you could not ask for better value to be right down town. We prepaid on line and saved 15% for a total around $80 a very good price for a downtown location. One does need to walk several blocks to the east to see the "East side of Vancouver" to see how the other half lives...............it isn't pretty and something needs to be done. Robson Street shopping, Gastown, China Town, Granville Street, BC Place and GM place are all just a short walk away. This hotel has been booked by Vanoc for the media for the Olympics but has some valuable rooms available prior to this event.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: smartcooki
Reviews.Content: I was heading to Vancouver for a weekend of sightseeing with a friend before going to Whistler. We were choosing among several hotel options, all within the $60 or so range. In the end, we selected the Ramada Limited Downtown based on reviews, location, and value and were not disappointed! We got a room with 2 single beds. It was very roomy and even had a couch and a coffee table. Everything was spotless and new, including the large bathroom. This hotel has free wireless internet as well as a desktop downstairs for everyone's free use. There is also a great breakfast every morning until 10:30am. It's not basic. It includes lots of options such as oatmeal, cereal, pancakes, fruit, toast, bagels, a variety of juices, coffee, tea, etc. We were impressed with the service as well as there is an employee making sure everyone gets what they're looking for there. It's a great free feature. The location of this hotel is great in terms of convenience. It's 2 blocks away from any metro line, including the Waterfront line that goes to the airport. It's also only 2 blocks from Gastown district, which we liked the most. Chinatown is down the street as well, and other areas are walkable too. The only things I would recommend to this hotel is to: add a full length mirror to the room and turn the heater down to a standard 70 degrees or so (it was at almost 90 when we walked in, which was pretty unbearable for the first 20 mins). Next time, I will also ask for a room that doesn't face Pender Street and that is on a higher floor. Being on second floor, we couldn't keep our curtains open since everyone from the street would be able to look in.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jules23797
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a trip to see a concert in oct of 2008 it was a cute and very clean little hotel with friendly staff and a daily contonental breakfast The location was close to G.M place (where the concert was). the pacific center mall, and all the cool shops. The pub next door was a great place to end out nights. The room we stayed in was a bit small but we didn't spend much time in it anyway so it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: ivanatravel09
Reviews.Content: This hotel definetly met my expectations and went above in terms of service and quality. Upon arrival we were upgraded from a regular room to the executive suite! The location was perfect, in the centre of downtown near Seymour which was just 3 min away from the downtown BCIT campus I had to attent daily after grabing a great breakfast at the hotel. Historic Gastown was also right around the corner. Busy and lively Granville and Robson street are near by too. The staff was always present and very helpful and knowledgable about what there was in the city and how to get there. The one and only thing that was a minor minus was that the walls seemed to be pretty thin, you could usually hear noises from the hall in the room and vice versa, but none the less for the price I paid, it was a minor thing and the stay was excellent! I will be back in the dry season :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: shellhelix
Reviews.Content: It is situated on a W. Pender Street, which the public transportation system is very accessible, whether train, bus or seabus. It is near to convenience stores and fastfood. It is very near to the downtown city's attractions like the Harbour Center, 20-min bus to Stanley Park, and 10-min seabus ride to Lonsdale Quay. Though situated on a busy street, the room is sound-proof. The room is compact, but the quality and cleanliness of the room makes up for it. Customer service is excellent. We stayed for one-night and the breakfast is more than continental. It included generous bagels, danishes, cereals, orange juice, fruits and has pancake-styled scrambled eggs. The breakfast-attendant make sure there is always abundant supply, utensils are complete, and the tables/chairs are clean/ready for the next occupants. We have given her a generous tip, though not required, which is worth taking the breakfast than grabbing one from to-go-breakfast station/s. One downside is the aisles'/corridor's smell due to dampness. Probably worth the management to invest further in forced heated ventilation. Don't worry, the faint smell doesn't go inside the bedrooms. Definitely worth the stay, will even do it next time --- a good bang for the buck! TIP: Staying in the rooms at the west side of the hotel would able to see the Harbour Center Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Prema_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ramada Downtown Vancouver for 2 nights before we took the Alaska cruise. The hotel is located close to the seafront as well as the historic gas town. The room was a trifle small, and had a view of the terrace of other buildings-so not great. But, once we got out of the hotel and walked out we were right in the heart of downtown and the water front. All the tours had a pick up point at the hotel itself. The breakfast was in a basement room. It was minimal with no hot food like omelette etc, but was sufficient. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and I will surely choose the same hotel if I were to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, decent area, acceptable price- but excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cam_Taters
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my first stay in Vancouver before moving out in the Spring. I found the check in was painless and efficient. They staff were very knowledgeable and easy to approach. The area is ok- I was not intimidated to walk in the area after dusk and the front entrance was well lit. Lobby was refreshing and well updated. Elevator was a little slow. Room was pleasant and well lit. Temperature was well regulated and room had tasteful decor. Window did not open all the way and was frosted- a bit of a bother. T.V. stopped working my first night there. Phone call to front desk got me the duty manager and the TV was replaced (or fixed- not sure which) the next day. Bathroom was clean and well maintained. Water pressure was hit and miss. Room price was decent value, however there is no on-site parking and valet to a parking lot is $20.00/ day, which I found a little unfair. Breakfast area was clean and well stocked at 7:30 AM, 8 AM, 9:15 AM and 10:10 AM. Housekeeping staff was friendly and willing to address any concerns. Hallways were clean and looked un-traveled (a rare occurence in many hotels). Stairways were clean and properly maintained. Valet service is sometimes backed up in the mornings, so call half hour ahead of time. Site does not have a pool or sauna- but I think it is acceptable for the area and age of the hotel. The building is a gem, and more surprising it is very well maintained. Many of these old buildings used as hotels are not kept up properly due to maintenance issues and costs, but that was not so in this case. Very impressed with staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 44rl44
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and happy to answer any questions. The room was on the small side but perfectly big enough and what you'd expect from a city centre hotel. There was still plenty of room to put things away. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bedding looked brand new. The bathroom was a good size and the shower was always hot and had good pressure. The breakfast was good and had a surprisingly large selection. The only problem was that it was so hot in the room, and gets quite crowded. We thought the hotel's location was excellent, and easy walking distance to most of the sights. In fact we walked everywhere, even to stanley park but that might be too far for some people. Yes there are homeless people but no more than anywhere else in the city. We felt perfectly safe but we didn't go out after dark so can't comment on what it was like then. The only negatives about our stay were that when we arrived the carpet in our room wasn't hoovered properly, although it was the next morning, and that although we heard no street or other guest noise, there was a really loud but unidentifiable white noise coming from the corridor. It may have been a fan or something like that but although it didn't keep us awake it was intrusive. Overall though I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: 616A81T5
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights. Staff v.goog. Liked the free internet (30min limit). Liked the include breakfast except the pre-mix juice (sugar hit). Basement breakfast room got a bit hot (June 2-6). Laundry was reasonable. Were upgraded to a larger room..it had a couch! Free filter coffee machine. Free ice as Mini-frig not available. 28 channels on the TV. Bed comfy. minimal noise even though we has street front rm. Didn't like the ho-bos outside. Close to Gas Town. Walked to light rail station near ferry port several times. 2-3 blocks to city centre. White Horse restuarant 10min walk was good value. Bus stop around next corner. Walked to Stanley Park via waterfront.- long walk but great scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: openrangepony
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an off the beaten track location that was close to public transportation and to the cruise ship launching site. The Ramada fit the bill. Okay, the neighborhood is sliding into the dicey side, but I like "real" people and I never once encountered panhandling even though I walked all over. The room was comfy, the bed and bedding were awesome, the bathroom was clean and spacious and well lit. Yes, the window was frosted and there was no view, but there was fresh air. Free wi-fi in the room. Yes, it might be depressing to spend long periods of time in a room with no view, but if you are a tourist and prefer to spend your money on good food and your time out seeing and doing, this Ramada is a good option. I was blind sided by the valet parking fee, but, given the comparetively reasonable cost of the room and the convenience of having the car safely stowed away, I got over that.

Reviews.Title: “value for categorey”
Reviews.Author: huggletasmania
Reviews.Content: stayed twice to and from our rockies alaskian trip and found the rooms of good value for the star rating breakfast included free internet close to down town walking distance to gastown and ship terminal and shops also main business centre no need for taxis staff were great also a great little cafe called the old house across the street which supplied better meals than anywhere else we ate in the 3 weeks and at a betterprice than others happy service and efficient the best place to eat

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for budget traveller without car”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_BudgetCouple
Reviews.Content: When we first saw the mixed reviews on the website, we weren't sure what to make of it, but my husband and I decided to give it a go. We were VERY HAPPY we did. STAFF: Friendly, very helpful. No downsides ROOM: Extremely clean. Fresh smelling. Windows that open! (For all you asthmatics out there) Sheets and covers looked brand new. ROOM DOWNSIDE: A king bed = 2 singles pulled together, you can hear noises from the hall, but in our case, not from the neighbouring rooms. CONTINENTAL BREAKFEAST: We were actually impressed since we were only expecting coffee, bagels and muffins. In addition to that, we found 3 types of juices, several different types of teas. Also, Pancakes, French toast and scrambled eggs (albeit from frozen, but that's ok), some fruit, milk, and several cereals. There were even flavoured coffee creamers and a wide assortment of jams! LOBBY/STAIRCASE/HALLWAY: Very well maintained, tastefully decorated. Has an antique look. Complimentary computer with internet access available in the front lobby for those of us without laptops. HALL DOWNSIDE: Does smell a little stale. NEIGHBORHOOD: Close to most interesting sites and public transit. We stayed over the Easter weekend. Having lived in Montreal and now Toronto, we found the neighbourhood quite tame. Yes we were solicited for money by a homeless person near the hotel once over the 4 days, BUT we were also asked for money in front of many different hotels across the whole downtown. (We were on foot). What amazed us the most in this respect is that Vancouver's homeless/money solicitors did not seem to be confined to one area, but rather, they are spread across the city. Had we stayed at a $150 per night hotel ONLY for the reason of not having homeless people ask us for money, then we would have been disappointed. In conclusion, each person is different. However, having no car, we thought this hotel was EXCELLENT VALUE for the money we paid ($63 per night). If having a beautiful view, swimming pool, a full restaurant, and/or gym room is essential to you then this is NOT the hotel for you. If you are a budget traveller whose needs are few, go for it! It's great!

Reviews.Title: “It has its ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: ThisCaliTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room smelled a little funny and was VERY cramped. The nightly rate for this hotel was decent, so I can't complain too much about the room itself. The beds were comfortable, and I slept like a baby. Conversations in the hallway could be heard, but this wasn't a big issue late at night. The front desk staff (for the MOST part) very incredibly friendly and helpful. They were eager to provide information and directions and even asked if we enjoyed our visits to local tourist attractions. There's always one bad seed in the bunch, which is the only reason I can't give this hotel a 5 for service. Parking costs an additional $25 per night, and its by valet only. Valet is open from 7am until 11pm. BEWARE if you need to check out earlier than 7am! We explained our situation to the staff when we first checked in. On two separate occasions, we were told to just ask the person at the front desk to find someone to grab our car for us even if it isn't 7am yet. However, when we went to check out, the woman at the front desk handed us the keys and told us to get the car ourselves. She sent us out in the rain to a dark alley, and when her directions did not lead us to where our car would be and we walked back to the front desk, she reminded us that valet service was unavailable until 7am and we would need to go back and look everywhere for our car if we REALLY needed it. She stated that if she were in our position and she REALLY needed her car, she would be walking all throughout the parking garage trying to find her car instead of asking the employees to help her. The situation was not resolved until another employee came and volunteered to help us. All of the hotel employees had left great impressions on us until our last point of interaction (and final, lasting impression) with the hotel employees upon checkout. For the "service" she gave us, it would be a safer bet to find a different hotel to stay at the next time we're in town. There are plenty of other hotels with great locations and nearby restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, so-so neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SDMRT
Reviews.Content: If you are not picky at to the neighborhood, it is a good value for a place to sleep and base camp for a visit to Vancouver, BC. The hotel is multi-story and compact. For $25 Canadian they will securely valet park your car. Desk staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean, if a little small, and the internet is reliable. The free breakfast had good variety. It's location leaves a little to be desired. Bums and panhandlers were everywhere, but it is a short walk to the Hudson Bay Company store and the "Sky Train" light rail transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rate, Great Location....but not a quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gammaray
Reviews.Content: Before I start, I want to say that I read most of the reviews already listed on this site for the Ramada Limited in Vancouver. Most were positive and I understood that this would not be a 'five star' hotel. That being said, I booked this hotel for a romantic getaway. My first impression was...."great location, old world charm, clean rooms, and an excellent complimentary breakfast". All of these were true. This hotel is close to Gastown and Chinatown, a couple blocks away from the waterfront, three blocks away from Robson street shopping, and is a short ride away from Stanley Park. With a good pair of shoes, an understanding of the bus system, and a flexible time schedule, you could see the whole city in 2 to 3 days. The hotel itself is nice. Classic charm, nice lobby, free WiFi, helpful staff, decent valet service, and the rooms are clean. One of the best features of this hotel is the complimentary breakfast. Hot pancakes or french toast, hot eggs, cold cereal, fruit, toast, milk, juices, tea, coffee, etc. They even have a microwave for those who want to heat up their own meal. Also, there are two good restaurants close by (Malone's Bar and Grill and The Century Restaurant and Bar) and several night spots to dance the night away. Now, the bad stuff. The valet parking is $25 dollars a night! Period! I was mislead to believe that the valet parking was complimentary. With not many on street parking spots available and parking lots with NO 'in/out' privileges, the valet parking is your only real option. This added cost will make your 'good deal' room rate go up to an average to high room rate. The rooms are sort of small but, that is not the issue. The room we had was poorly vented. The fan in the bathroom didn't do a good job of removing moisture. Our bathroom had mold in the shower. Unacceptable! The hotel is suppose to be a non-smoking building but, cigarette smoke was inside the elevator every time we got in it. I know its possible for a person who just left the elevator to smell it up but, all the time? The walls of the hotel/rooms seem thin because we could hear any and all activity in the hallways and some from other rooms. Another negative is the construction going on in the city of Vancouver. Expect to have delays getting around town during the day. Also, with the 2010 Olympics coming to this town, its best to book a trip now BEFORE summer. After that, you are going to be in a Olympic size mess of people! Now, the issue with 'street people' as mentioned in other reviews was not a factor with us. We live in the Seattle, WA area. People asking for money, wanting you to buy something from them, or people just wanting to yell at you is an every day event. Granted, if you are traveling with your family, I recommend staying away from the area between Gastown and Chinatown all the time (day or night) and not walking around the hotel at night. Other than that, the street people are harmless. Overall, we had a great time. The issue with the misinformation about the valet parking was resolved (they gave us a day free) and we had a good experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please, no disco!”
Reviews.Author: Kazza9173
Reviews.Content: We were starting off a 3 city tour and were booked at this hotel. The room we were allocated was small but clean and adequate for our 3 night stay, which was Thursday to Sunday. What we didn't bargain was that on Friday and Saturday was that a disco in a club next to the hotel would go on all night. We were on the first floor and at the front of the hotel. It felt like we were in the middle of the dancefloor. We're not a pair of old timers but it was really too much. On the Saturday it became unbearable, especially as we had an early start the next day. We asked for a move and the staff did oblige. However we were given a smokers room which was really very smoky. When we checked out on the Sunday I spoke with the duty manager who apologised for the intrusive noise but said that the management of the club - which was not part of the hotel - refused to co-operate with any requests for soundproofing. She gave us advice on how to go about getting a part refund on the cost of our stay. Customer service was a definate strongpoint of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & Location”
Reviews.Author: vlandgw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and for value for money and location could not fault it. Bus, train and sea bus (ferry) all within a few minutes walk. Friendly & helpful staff. Decent breakfast included in room price. Rooms are on small side but are clean and all that is needed when you are out of them most of the time. Easy to walk to most areas of interest although buses handy too (best value is $9.00 day pass for bus, train, sea bus). Yes there are homeless people around the area but we saw that all over Vancouver - not just near this hotel. We would stay here again if in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in translation”
Reviews.Author: hartek
Reviews.Content: I went on cruise with the family and we were staying here for that night before the cruise. Well we get to the hotel and they told me it was reserved for the hotel across town. Which is not true, cause I called the hotel directly. The little manager tried to talk his way out of it, but I didn't call an 800 number or book it through a travel site, I called them directly. So his lies didn't go far with me. Since it was less than 24 hour till my reservation, we had stay at the one across town, which not very convenient to the ship terminal. The other hotel had a fairly rude staff as well, but that seemed to be fairly common for Vancouver. Neither hotel is in that nice of areas. Live and learn

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: tgaff
Reviews.Content: We had a party of six stay here before a cruise and had a positive experience. It is within walking distance of the cruise port. The front desk people, esp. a nice young, tall woman with a great smile who worked days, were top-rate. The rooms are small. but clean and decorated well. We stayed there before the cruise, but they let us store our luggage the next week after the cruise so we could explore the city. Also, one of the people in our party left a coat behind before the cruise and it was waiting for us when we returned afterward. An excellent value and an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “SImple and cosy hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: charleskwek
Reviews.Content: Three of us booked the suite (indicated in the website - suitable for 6 people) for a week. The suite was clean and in my opinion, just nice for 4 people. It was too small for 6. The free broadband access was great as 3 of us surfed the web simultaneously. The receptionists were helpful and assisted us in our requests diligently. The hotel location is conveniently situated and well within walking distance to shopping areas such as Robson and even Gastown (30 min walk). Will definitely consider staying in Ramada again if I return to downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pleasant surprises!”
Reviews.Author: likesitquiet
Reviews.Content: This is one very friendly hotel which we would not hesitate to recommend. We reserved there for the value but will be back because of the friendly staff and the location. We already knew that we could drop off our suitcases early but when we did that at 9:30 a.m., they gave us the key to our room at 9:30 a.m. because it was ready! The room itself was immaculate, with terry cloth robes and bottled water - all in downtown Vancouver for $149 per night! The room was a bit small (the king bed took up a lot of the room) but very comfy bed and efficient air conditioners. Transit at the door, seabus station 5-minute walk. Great location for sightseeing. As for the location, as long as you turn right when leaving the hotel, you will be fine. (Mind you, go left if you want to be in Chinatown in a few minutes). Breakfast is included with the room with TWO hot items (scrambled eggs with either pancakes or french toast) as well as the usual offerings, glass plates and staff on hand to help.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs--no sleep all night!”
Reviews.Author: myfuntravels
Reviews.Content: We went to bed around midnight but woke up not long afterwards feeling itchy. We ignored it at first, thinking it was due to a new place and the small beds (twins). It was not until we turned on the lights and saw swollen red bumps all over our arms that we knew it was something else. We ended up catching 5 of these critters, including 2 huge ones that squirted blood when they were killed. We went to the front desk but were told they couldn’t help up until 8am in the morning because the manager wasn’t in and they had no new rooms they could move us to. We ended up sitting on the floor (didn’t dare go near the bed anymore) all through the morning. Will update later with how management deals with this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, clean hotel near Gastown, cruise ships and downtown sights”
Reviews.Author: Randy1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Limited for one night before our cruise. We had a very nice stay. The hotel is small and unimpressive from the outside, but the interior is very nicely decorated and very clean. The room was a little bit small, but this an older hotel and we were very comfortable. The folks at the front desk were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. I really appreciate the help they gave us during our short stay! The location is easy walking distance to the things we wanted to see and do in the area (eat, walk along Robson Street, Gastown, etc.). We did take a taxi to our cruise ship at Canada Place since hauling all of our bags the half mile or so would have been to much, but the taxi far was cheap (around $10 plus tip). If you are looking for a big, modern, spacious hotel in a gleaming tourist district, this isn't the hotel for you. If you want a charming, clean, older hotel with a fantastic staff at a very reasonable price, this is a hotel I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: molletts
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Ramada Downtown on a previous visit to Vancouver and decided to stay there the night before we left for an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was as we remembered from 2 years before, small rooms but comfortable. We had friends travelling with us on the cruise and they also stayed here on our recommendation. One of them was on her own so she shared our room which was a little cramped but it was only for one night. The breakfast, included in the price, was still great and the big advantage this time was that we could walk to Canada Place to board the ship. The only downside is the location which isn't bad but the seedy parts of Gastown are moving closer. If you turn right when you leave the hotel you will be fine. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Fleedom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. Excellent location only 2 blocks from Gas Town and transport. Clean room with huge comfortable bed. We had requested a quiet room and ours was at the back of the building overlooking the wharf although there were railway lines in between but it was very quiet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free guest computer with internet access. It was exceptional value and breakfast was even thrown in. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Location was great”
Reviews.Author: bigqkevin
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL WAS CLEAN AND WELL RUN. The buses run right outside, and skytrain is a few blocks away. i was able to enjoy the city for 4 days. next door is a good bar w/food. room was small but very comfortable.. loved the breakfast. overall i liked being close to transportation and gas town, considering the prices in vancouver...this was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small dark room”
Reviews.Author: looneyfox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a brilliant location so you can walk to most things or get a bus. We had no problems with the hotel and the rooms were clean. Only one thing bothered us which was that our room which was for our honeymoon had a view of an alley which made the room very dark and on top of that it was a lot smaller than the rooms in the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada all the way!!! 3 years in a row.”
Reviews.Author: mikewebster2
Reviews.Content: For the third year in a row, I chose the Ramada for my week's worth of holidays. Vancouver is such a great city, and this property is close to all of the areas I want to be near. The staff were great throughout (extra pillows, blanket ... no problem), and you'd be hard pressed to beat the rate. There's a restaurant right next door which is very handy, a coffee shop on the other side, convenience store and liquor store a 1/2 block away. No problem referring anyone to this hotel. Merry Christmas everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Two star facilities but four star service”
Reviews.Author: Manx_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Hotel accommodation in Vancouver generally appears to be quite expensive so we were pleased to find this hotel at a reasonable rate - GBP64 per room per night with continental breakfast included. Having read some previous reviews we were a little concerned but were pleased that these concerns were unfounded. The hotel was a two star - as such we aligned our expectations accordingly. However, we received a very friendly welcome and this staff attitude was consistant throughout our four night stay. The room was reasonably compact but provided a sufficient base. There was a bathroom with toileteries, TV, coffee-maker, chest of drawers, etc and room to store our suitcases. There was no outlook with a frosted window looking out onto a wall of the adjoining propery. As a two star hotel you cannot expect the sort of faciliites available in larger, more expensive hotels. However, a concierge service is available and the hotel kindly looked after our cases whilst we visited Whistler for two days. There is also free internet usage available in the hotel lobby. There is no restaurant or bar although there is a bar providing food next door. We did not try this so cannot comment on its suitability. Free continental breakfast is available. We liked this as it avoids either paying over-the-odds for an in-house breakfast or having to look outside for someone suitable. The breakfast provided a range of cereals, toast, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit and two hot items - usually two of pancakes, waffles or omelette - plus fruit juice, tea, coffee - it certainly gave you a good start to the day. The room is a bit small but if possible move to the boardroom which is sometimes opened up to accommodate a overspill. the breakfast staff worked very hard to keep the serving area well stocked. The locatiion is about 600m from Robson Street and also about 10 minutes walk from Canada Place, the cruise ships and also Gastown. There are one or two slightly unsavourary looking characters nearby so make sure you always turn right out of the hotel. There is a bus stop about 100m from the hotel and this takes you to, amongst other places, Stanley Park. Some comments on Vancouver itself. A very picturesque city. Stanley Park is a must and the likes of English Bar, Canada Place and Gas Town are worth a visit. Robson Street is the main thoroughfare but we found there to be a large number of beggars in this and the surrounding areas. The constant requests were off-putting and slightly intimidating. We bought a day pass for the buses,skytrain and cross harbour Seabus at a very reasonable $8 for the day. this enabled us to go over to North Vancouver for a few hours perhaps away from typical tourist traps. We took in Lynn Valley Park - this features a suspension bridge similar to Capilano Bridge but is free! Overall, we were pleased with our choice - it served us well, standards of services exceeded expectations and the money saved by staying in a two star enabled us to go a little more upmarket later in our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: mupppz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of downtown, many of the downtown attractions are within walking distance, it's less than a $10 cab fare to Granville Island, public transit at your door and a few of the downtown stops on the hop on/hop off are just a few minutes walk away. The hotel is clean, the bed was very comfortable, the pillows were lacking though...the towels were soft, the staff friendly and helpful...I got a good rate on expedia, however the hotel advised me when I checked in that they will beat/match online prices, so I suggest calling and seeing if you can get a better rate than online before you book! Breakfast was included with the room but it left a little to be desired, however if you just want something quick like cereal or a toasted bagel it's fine. Considering how expensive downtown Vancouver hotels can be, this place is a gem, if you don't need all the frills and just a clean room with a comfy bed at the end of a long day!

Reviews.Title: “Good HOtel”
Reviews.Author: ayna
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at the Ramada in Vancouver after I read some of the reviews. But I was pleasently surprised how clean the rooms were and the staff was also very friendly. Location was not bad either - there is a bus leaving just opposite the road going to the harbour but we also walked a couple of times. In the evenings we walked towards Yale Town for the restaurants. Staff was also really helpful. I think it is good value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: PT_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Ramada Downtown is very well located, close to Gastown, the old part of Vancouver, full of restaurants and stores. It also offers a good relation price / quality and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious and offered lots of amenities (bottles of water, body lotion, conditioner …) located in the executive floor (in fact we were upgraded without any additional cost). The most negative thing to point is the breakfast room, too small for the number of rooms and the lack of diversity of food when compared to European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the beds!”
Reviews.Author: ferretpeople
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be embarrassed and ashamed to have such terrible beds in their rooms. It was so old and worn my husband immediately rolled into the middle and sank. I slept with my head at the foot of the bed just to have a stable place. The room was tiny and not like the pictures and description said. The breakfast room was also tiny, hot and packed with people. Food was only adequate. The miserable night's sleep left me with a very bad feeling about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “may not suit everyone”
Reviews.Author: scotaussie
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is an expensive place for hotels. The Ramada Downtown however is good value with breakfast included in the rate. We stayed there twice before and after our trip to the Rockies.The location is good being close to the cruise terminal and the metro which next year will connect to the airport.It is also very close to gastown however this seems to be rather run down and did not have the choice of restuarants I would have expected.The area at night is on the border of being a bit seedy. The rooms are very small and once two suitcases are open on the floor there is little room left. However the general fit out is adequate and the rooms were clean. Continental breakfast is served in a basement area and is a bit of a shambles as the area is too small and the operator lacks much drive to make it work efficiently. You would not be happy if it was charged seperately. A laundry is available also in the basement which is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: charglob
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel to find that i had accidently booked the room for the next year... luckily the staff at the hotel had been in contact with my mum in Australia, and they fixed it all up and got us another room. The other booking was later refunded. The room was clean and nice and the breakfast was also fine. We dealt with a few different staff and they were all exceptionally friendly and helped us out with everything. It was right in the middle of the city and walking distace to everything. And the staff made sure we knew were to go and what there was to do. I highly reconmend this place for someone looking for a good priced friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jmraggs
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night for a post cruise day before flying out the next morning. All front desk personnal were friendly and helpful. Our room wasn't ready yet, so they stored the luggage until we arrived back from taking the trolly around town. This location is very good for access around town. The room was pleasant and clean and we were very comfortable. We left at 4:30 am which was too early for their breakfast, but the room looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: KRFLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within walking distance from cruise ship terminal and Gastown. Room was small but adequate, free continental breakfast just fair. Staff was helpful and friendly. My only criticism was with the free Internet service; you cannot open e-mail on AOL since Ramada has set up some type of block. I have not encountered this problem at other hotels. Other e-mail providers work OK. Otherwise, a good location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: 3Jacks
Reviews.Content: When I booked my room over 2 months before our trip, I was under the assumption we would get a Queen or King size bed (per the description on Expedia’s website). We were in Vancouver to run in the Vancouver marathon, so a comfortable bed was very important. Well, when we got to our room, it was only a double (and it was very short, our feet hung off the end, and we are average height). I called the front desk to ask why, and she said because we booked on Expedia, we were not guaranteed a bed size, and that was all they had. I felt very cheated, and she made it sound like if we had booked directly, we would have gotten a better room. Also, the parking was super expensive, it cost us $25 per day, plus tipping the valet, and tax on top of it all. You do not have easy access to go to your car and get something you might have forgotten, as the car is parked a block down, in a parking garage. The breakfast was just so so, I have had much better at other hotels. Most of the hotel staff were very nice, with the exception of the person who checked us in, he was less then pleasant, but everyone else was great. The location was fine, but I think you can find a better hotel for the same price (especially if you include the price of parking).

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover”
Reviews.Author: rainbowtravel
Reviews.Content: We flew into Vancouver and needed a place to stay before catching the train the next day. Reviews for this place seemed decent, and the price of $69 CAD sealed the deal. It was small as others have said, but plenty big enough for our purposes. The stone floor in bathroom was nice. The room and bathroom were very clean. The staff was nice, and the complimentary breakfast was good - muffins, bagels, breads to toast, sweet rolls, eggs, waffles, juices, coffee, tea, etc. The steam clock and China town were easy to walk to, and the staff we encountered were all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: lucindah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2007 for 3 nights and were very happy particularly with the location and the price we paid. We asked for a quiet room and certainly heard no noise where we were. The staff was very helpful and friendly, happy to give directions and information. As suggested in other reviews the rooms are rather small but we had 2 doubles and enough room to move about. The bathroom was small but adequate and the free breakfast was an added bonus - plenty of variety of fresh items - cereals, pastries, juices, bagels, toast, fruit, yoghurts, waffles, eggs etc. We really liked the hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean -- in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: Pros: -The location couldn't be better. At the corner of Granville and Davie, you're right in the heart of the hippest part of downtown Vancouver; walking distance to all the bars, clubs and restaurants. -The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable -- they help with directions, maps, taxis, lunch/dinner suggestions, etc. -Free Internet kiosk in the lobby, available 24/7. -Prompt and thorough housekeeping -Free cable TV with plenty of channels Cons: -I smelled cigarette smoke coming from down the hall, despite the entire floor being "non-smoking" -The street noise can be fairly bothersome on weekend evenings -World's slowest elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bkfst Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: PuddlenBoots
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend stay at the Ramada downtown Vancouver on West Pender street. From the moment I arrived the front desk people and the concierge were amazing and catered to my every need. They were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very nicely done and the bathroom even had a beautiful pedistal sink! I stayed in a double bed room and the beds were very comfortable (which is very important to me). The free continental breakfast is outstanding and included: coffee, tea, 4 types of juice, hot and cold cereal, bagels, toast, apples, a bunch of different kinds of yogurt, eggs, and waffles/pancakes. The service in there was awesome and they kept it very clean. It was just amazing that for the price of the hotel all of these things were so well done. The area is not too bad. I am from the coast so I knew what to expect. You are a block from where things are really "cleaned up" in the downtown area. There are a lot of homeless people in Vancouver - they go there because of the climate and there is alot of soup kitchens and such. I only passed two on my way to and from the hotel....which I dont think is bad. You get that even in the $400 per night hotels. The hotel is close to lots of restaurants (sushi, pubs, etc) and if you are a Tim Horton's fan, there is one a block south west of the hotel...which is handy. Pacific Centre mall and Robson street shopping are only 3 ish blocks away....which is very good too. All in all I was blown away. I will be staying again in February because this trip was so excellent. The only issue some may have is that because it is an historical building I think the walls are thinner than the new hotels. I heard some partiers next door in the wee hours of the morning....so take your earplugs so that you wont be annoyed. Happy Trails!

Reviews.Title: “Solid place”
Reviews.Author: Econometrics
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my girl-friend right after Christmas. The location is good, downtown center and everything in the area can be done on foot. Stanley park is a circa 25 minutes walk. Restaurants are in walking distance and neighborhood seems safe. The rooms are nice and clean. We had a room facing another building which meant that we never had any sunlight, it was quiet though. Breakfast is better than basic: cereal, fruits, bagels, muffins, tea, juice, coffee, yoghurt, and more. Staff was very friendly. Parking is a problem in downtown, we paid 20 CAD per 24hrs at the hotel which seemed ok. All in all good experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “well, it was clean... and it was neat...”
Reviews.Author: atlantic_transplant
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quaint. They could possibly play up the "boutique"-ness of the hotel a bit more. Nice retro music in the lobby when we arrived, also quaint old-style furniture, and twenty-dollar valet parking available (no other options aside from street parking). We got a free upgrade to the executive floor, right outside the bright red and yellow neon of the Ramada sign. Bed was clean, and the room exactly fit the queen size bed, 1-2 feet of walking space around the bed, a dresser/cabinet with a television, and a small desk. Bathroom was nice, with what appeared to be stone tile floor. That was surprising, but nice. Breakfast was a "deluxe" continental. That means regular continental, plus warm pancakes and something that resembled eggs over hard (most likely from the microwave). It was interesting, and served in the breakfast area that had no windows, no ventilation, in the basement (B is for breakfast and B is also for basement). Pros: relatively cheap, clean sheets, free wireless internet, walkable to GM place (15 mins) where we went to watch a hockey game Cons: small "suite", breakfast room was too warm

Reviews.Title: “A bargain”
Reviews.Author: Conferenceweary
Reviews.Content: Turfed from my sold-out conference hotel for a single Friday night, I got a great rate at the Ramada downtown at the last minute. Chose it because of: affordability, free wireless internet (NOT provided at my v. expensive conference hotel), and location (walking distance to Gastown, shopping, night life and far enough from bad neighbourhood for single female traveller to safely stay). Stay was hassle-free and very comfortable, especially compared to my previous 4-star hotel that cost four times as much. I was allowed to check in early, got free local calls and internet, had guests to visit in my room with no bother. Room was spotless and nicely decorated. Shower had great water pressure compared to other place. After a day of shopping I did not want to get out of that shower! Lovely. Breakfast was pretty good tho meatless ... after a night on the town, I appreciated all the free juice! The pub downstairs was actually really good too. The owner was working the door and kept the crowd age appropriate and not too rowdy/drunk. Sweetheart never gave me a problem as I went in and out to smoke, stop in my room, &c even tho he had a lineup going. The only drawbacks were that the room was a tiny bit cramped (too much furniture). A final word about the neighbourhood. Street people and filthy streets is a VANCOUVER problem not a hotel problem. You will encounter this element pretty much everywhere you go in downtown Vancouver. Its the City's fault not the Ramada's. With an attentive front staff I never felt unsafe coming and going from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSJ
Reviews.Content: I had seen some bad reviews on this hotel and was apprehensive. However I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived. The hotel is clean and quite. The staff are helpful. The room I stayed in was quite small but perfectly adequate. The hotel is located just outside the main business/ shopping core, but not so far out that you trend into the less pleasant eastern quarter of the city. The rate I paid was modest and very very good value for money for acceptable quality. I travel a lot and will definitely come back here regularly. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget but doesn't want to end up in a shack.
